title: Pope Leo heads to Turkiye, Lebanon in first foreign trip as Catholic leader
summary: First American pope will arrive in the Turkish capital Ankara where he will meet President Erdogan.

title: Train collision in China kills 11 railway maintenance workers: Reports
summary: Accident involved a train conducting a test of seismic equipment, state-run Xinhua says.

title: National Guardsmen shot in Washington DC: What happened, who’s the suspect?
summary: Trump calls it a 'terror' attack, as US officials identified an Afghan national as the suspect, announcing visa curbs.

title: Hong Kong blaze death toll reaches 55 as rescue operations continue
summary: Rescue efforts continue as Hong Kong fire devastates a residential complex, leaving 55 dead and hundreds displaced.

title: Gasfield in northern Iraq hit by drone attack: Reports
summary: About 80 percent of the power grid in semi-autonomous Kurdish region disrupted after drone attack on Khor Mor gasfield.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,372
summary: Here are the key events from day 1,372 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: Myanmar’s military rulers grant amnesty to thousands ahead of election
summary: Order reduces sentences for 3,085 people and drops charges against another 5,580 people still at large.

title: Emissions seen “few months” before Ethiopia volcano erupted
summary: Juliet Biggs, discusses the signs leading up to the eruption of a volcano in Ethiopia after it had been dormant.

title: Thousands left homeless by fire in Bangladesh shantytown in Dhaka
summary: Some 60,000 families, many of them climate refugees, live in the area spread over 65 hectares.

title: Hong Kong fire live: Blaze kills at least 55, hundreds still missing
summary: Firefighters struggle to reach residents potentially trapped on upper floors of burning housing complex.

title: Australia clamps downs on ‘nudify’ sites used for AI-generated child abuse
summary: Three websites used to create abuse imagery had received 100,000 monthly visits from Australians, watchdog says.

title: Miss Universe owners face fraud and trafficking allegations
summary: Arrest warrant issued for missing Thai mogul Anne Jakkaphong Jakrajutatip, as co-owner investigated in Mexico.

title: "Nous sommes prêts à négocier" sur le nucléaire avec Trump, dit le chef de la diplomatie iranienne
summary: Dans un entretien exclusif accordé à France 24, le ministre iranien des Affaires étrangères Abbas Araghchi affirme que l'Iran est "toujours prêt à négocier" sur le nucléaire avec les États-Unis, mais il déplore l'absence de "désir réel de négociation" du côté américain. Il annonce que l'échange des prisonniers français Cécile Kohler et Jacques Paris devrait avoir lieu "au cours des deux prochains mois". Sur Israël, il assure que "l'Iran est sorti victorieux" de la guerre de juin.

title: En Cisjordanie occupée, Israël lance une "vaste opération antiterroriste"
summary: Israël a annoncé avoir lancé mercredi une nouvelle opération contre des groupes armés palestiniens dans le nord de la Cisjordanie occupée. L'armée affirme vouloir empêcher "des tentatives d'établir des bastions terroristes" dans la région.

title: En Syrie, "c'est la punition collective contre les alaouites"
summary: Sur la côte syrienne, la peur a cédé la place à la colère : des milliers d’alaouites sont descendus dans la rue pour dénoncer les meurtres, les pillages, les enlèvements et les expulsions dont ils sont victimes depuis mars 2025. Une campagne de “punition collective” qui, selon l’expert Fabrice Balanche, menace désormais l’ensemble des minorités du pays.

title: Localisation sur X : Israël accuse à tort un journaliste de Gaza d'être basé en Pologne
summary: Le ministère israélien des Affaires étrangères israélien a affirmé sur X le 23 novembre que le journaliste gazaoui Motasem Ahmed Dalloul était en réalité basé en Pologne, en s'appuyant sur la nouvelle fonctionnalité de localisation du réseau social X. Mais le journaliste est bien à Gaza.

title: Israël a reçu la dépouille d'un des derniers otages de Gaza
summary: Israël a reçu, via le Comité international de la Croix-Rouge (CICR), la dépouille présumée d'un des derniers otages à Gaza, ont indiqué mardi les autorités israéliennes.

title: Violences faites aux femmes : au Pakistan, les influenceuses en ligne de mire
summary: Au Pakistan, des femmes sont assassinées parce qu'elles ont un compte TikTok, l’un des réseaux sociaux les plus populaires dans le pays. Le 11 juillet, à Rawalpindi, une adolescente de 16 ans a été abattue par son père parce qu’elle refusait de supprimer son profil. Un mois plus tôt, Sana Yusaf, 17 ans et près d’un million d’abonnés, était assassinée à son domicile d’Islamabad par un homme dont elle avait rejeté les avances. Les influenceuses, elles, sont mal vues et prises pour cible. Reportage de Shahzaib Wahlah et Ondine de Gaulle.

title: Israël - Gaza : comment la nouvelle fonctionnalité de X a alimenté la désinformation
summary: Le journaliste palestinien basé à Gaza Motasem Ahmed Dalloul est accusé par Israël de manipulation et de diffuser des contenus mensongers sur ses réseaux sociaux. Il serait en réalité basé… en Pologne. Une "information" véhiculée après que le réseau social X a ajouté une nouvelle fonctionnalité "A propos du compte". L'option a créé la confusion et alimenté la désinformation.

title: Gaza : l'organisation humanitaire controversée GHF annonce la fin de sa mission dans l'enclave
summary: L'organisation humanitaire controversée GHF – soutenue par Israël et les États-Unis et vivement critiquée par l'ONU – a annoncé lundi avoir terminé sa mission à Gaza, selon un communiqué.

title: Israël limoge des généraux pour leur échec à prévenir le 7-Octobre
summary: L'armée israélienne a annoncé lundi le limogeage de plusieurs généraux qui étaient à des postes clef lors des attaques du 7-Octobre. Ils seront déchargés "du cadre de réserve" et ne feront "plus partie" de l'armée.

title: Israël tue le chef militaire du Hezbollah dans des frappes à Beyrouth
summary: Une frappe israélienne sur la banlieue sud de Beyrouth a tué le chef militaire du Hezbollah libanais, Haitham Ali Tabatabai. C'est le plus haut responsable du Hezbollah à être tué depuis l'entrée en vigueur du cessez-le-feu, il y a près d'un an. Pour le mouvement chiite pro-iranien, Israël a franchi une nouvelle ligne rouge. Explications d'Ava Luquet.

title: La frappe israélienne près de Beyrouth a fait cinq morts et 28 blessés
summary: Une frappe israélienne a causé la mort d'au moins cinq personnes au Liban. Serge Berberi, notre correspondant au Liban, analyse la situation.

title: Frappe meurtrière à Beyrouth : Israël dit avoir tué le "chef d'état-major" du Hezbollah
summary: Israël a dit avoir tué Haitham Ali Tabataba, présenté comme le "chef d'état-major" du Hezbollah, dans une frappe sur la banlieue sud de Beyrouth. Le Hezbollah a confirmé sa mort dans un communiqué publié dans la soirée. Cette attaque a fait au moins cinq morts et 28 blessés, selon un bilan du ministère libanais de la Santé.

title: Annulation dans l’Etat de Géorgie de la dernière enquête contre Donald Trump pour tentative de coup d’Etat en 2021
summary: La procédure visait les pressions exercées par Donald Trump, en janvier 2021, sur le secrétaire d’Etat de Géorgie, pour inverser le résultat de l’élection présidentielle. Sans laver l’actuel locataire de la Maison blanche de tout soupçon, le juge en charge de l’affaire a estimé qu’« il n’existe pas de perspective réaliste » de le voir comparaître dans un procès.

title: Donald Trump triple le coût d’entrée des parcs nationaux pour les touristes internationaux, à 250 dollars
summary: Cette hausse des tarifs intervient alors que le tourisme international aux Etats-Unis est déjà en baisse.

title: En Turquie, le pouvoir islamo-conservateur a apaisé les relations avec les minorités religieuses
summary: La communauté chrétienne turque, sur le déclin, accueille, jeudi, le pape Léon XIV. Cette visite intervient alors que Recep Tayyip Erdogan a mis en place une relation plus libérale avec les minorités non musulmanes, en dépit de quelques accès de tensions, comme lors de la conversion en mosquée de Sainte-Sophie.

title: L’Algérie se lance dans une offensive de charme vis-à-vis des Etats-Unis
summary: Alger a multiplié ces dernières semaines les gestes de bonne volonté en direction de l’administration Trump dans l’espoir de sortir de son isolement régional.

title: Après une attaque contre deux membres de la garde nationale à Washington, l’administration Trump veut revoir le statut des Afghans résidant aux Etats-Unis
summary: Deux militaires déployés dans la capitale américaine sont dans un état critique après avoir été pris pour cible par un Afghan arrivé aux Etats-Unis en 2021, selon les autorités. Donald Trump a accusé l’administration Biden d’avoir laissé entrer des citoyens afghans sans contrôle au moment de la chute de Kaboul aux mains des talibans.

title: Le pape Léon XIV se rend en Turquie et au Liban pour ses premiers pas sur la scène internationale
summary: A l’occasion de ses premiers pas sur la scène internationale, le chef de l’Eglise catholique célébrera le 1 700ᵉ anniversaire du concile de Nicée. Mais les enjeux de ce premier voyage dépasse le cadre strictement religieux.

title: Pourquoi nos vêtements usagés atterrissent aux Emirats arabes unis
summary: Le pays s’est imposé comme un leader du tri de fripes, profitant notamment de l’incapacité de l’Europe à traiter ses propres stocks. Cette délocalisation porte un coût écologique et social certain.

title: En Chine, les journées sans fin des petites mains de l’économie des plateformes
summary: Les applis de services, de livraison et de mobilité façonnent la nouvelle économie chinoise. Dans une société aux maigres filets de protection, elles promettent un meilleur revenu aux travailleurs de première ligne, au prix d’efforts extrêmes.

title: A Mexico, un musée dédié à Frida Kahlo s’arrange avec la vérité
summary: Depuis son ouverture, cet automne, dans la capitale mexicaine, le nouveau musée consacré à la peintre enchaîne les controverses. Contrairement à ce que prétendent les propriétaires, cette maison n’aurait jamais été le foyer de la famille Kahlo et une fresque découverte sur place n’aurait jamais été réalisée par l’artiste.

title: Aurélien Colson, politiste : « Tout “plan de paix” qui accorderait à Moscou un droit de veto sur l’avenir de l’Ukraine est une capitulation »
summary: Dans une tribune au « Monde », le professeur de science politique met en regard la place des héritages soviétiques dans l’attitude de Vladimir Poutine et les négociations visant à mettre fin à la guerre. Il appelle les démocraties occidentales à « tenir bon ».

title: Au procès de Lafarge, plongée dans l’engrenage qui a conduit le cimentier à signer un pacte avec les djihadistes
summary: Le tribunal correctionnel de Paris a examiné, mardi 25 et mercredi 26 novembre, le cœur du dossier : les paiements versés aux groupes terroristes, de 2012 à 2014. Radiographie sidérante du naufrage de cette multinationale dans le conflit syrien.

title: Emmanuel Macron va annoncer un service militaire volontaire, sur fond de « menaces croissantes »
summary: Le service national universel (SNU), qui n’a pas atteint ses objectifs, va être transformé en service national volontaire, pour accueillir des milliers de Français dès 2026.

title: Israeli settlers set up new outpost on Palestinian land near Nablus
summary:
Israeli settlers set up new outpost on Palestinian land near Nablus

Israeli settlers on Thursday established a new settlement outpost on Palestinian land in the town of Jamma’in, south of Nablus in the occupied West Bank, local media reported. 

On 20 November, Israeli media reported that another new settlement was established in the Gush Etzion area near the city of Bethlehem. 

Human Rights Watch said that Israel has been carrying out the forced displacement of Palestinians in the West Bank since January 2025. 

"Israel's forced displacement of residents from three refugee camps in the West Bank amounts to war crimes and crimes against humanity," HRW said.

title: Israel to bring 5,800 Bnei Menashe Jews from India for settlement in occupied Palestine
summary:
Israel to bring 5,800 Bnei Menashe Jews from India for settlement in occupied Palestine

Israel is reportedly set to bring more than 5,800 Jewish community members from India to Israel for settlement in the Galilee region of the northern part of the occupied Palestinian territories. 

The Jewish Agency for Israel, an organisation that promotes Zionism globally has said that the Israeli cabinet has approved the proposal.

The Bnei Menashe Jewish community is an ethnic community from the northeastern Indian states of Mizoram and Manipur. 

The report said that the plan was submitted by Immigration and Integration Minister Ofir Sofer.

A large delegation of rabbis is expected to depart for India in the coming days and the plan is expected to require a special budget to cover conversion classes, housing, and Hebrew instruction.

title: Israel to deploy ‘Morpheus’ AI system to monitor soldiers’ social media
summary:
Israel to deploy ‘Morpheus’ AI system to monitor soldiers’ social media

The Israeli army said it will deploy a new Artificial Intelligence technology system called Morpheus to monitor the social media accounts of its soldiers and verify everything they post, including texts, pictures, and videos.

The Israeli army radio reported on Wednesday that Hamas had established a huge intelligence network before 7 October 2023, through which it obtained information about the army and its movements from soldiers’ accounts on social media platforms.

The radio station added that the new step aims to "reduce this phenomenon", adding that if necessary, the system will be able to identify cases for review by information security officials.

The report said that during a four-month trial phase of the system, accounts of 45,000 soldiers were monitored, and thousands of cases were recorded that required deletion of posts deemed sensitive.

title: House raids, gas bombs reported as Israeli forces enter refugee camps in West Bank
summary:
House raids, gas bombs reported as Israeli forces enter refugee camps in West Bank

Israeli forces on Thursday stormed the town of Anabta, east of the city of Tulkarm and the Balata refugee camp east of Nablus in the occupied West Bank, local media reported. 

The report said that a foot patrol spread out in the Balata camp and raided a house in the Hashashin quarter. 

Israeli forces also raided homes during their incursion into the town of Nuba, northwest of Hebron and used gas bombs during their raid on the Ras Khamis neighbourhood in the Shuafat refugee camp, northeast of occupied Jerusalem.

title: Israel sends reinforcements as siege of West Bank town tightens
summary:
Israel sends reinforcements as siege of West Bank town tightens

Israeli forces on Thursday deployed new military reinforcements to the town of Tammun, south of Tubas in the occupied West Bank, Palestinian media reported. 

Israeli forces have laid siege to the town of Tammun in the Tubas Governorate, located 13 kilometres northeast of Nablus in the West Bank, where at least 60 Palestinians have been arrested and dozens have been forcibly displaced from their homes.  

The mayor Tammun said that the forces have displaced many families, turning their homes into military barracks and sealed the town.

The Israeli army also cut off roads connecting the town with the rest of the West Bank, and severed electricity lines and drinking water pipes.

title: West Bank: Red Crescent says two staffers wounded in Israeli attack
summary:
West Bank: Red Crescent says two staffers wounded in Israeli attack

The Palestinian Red Crescent Society on Thursday said that two of its members were wounded as a result of an attack by the Israeli forces on them in the town of Qabatiya, south of Jenin in the occupied West Bank.

On Wednesday, the organisation had said that dozens of Palestinians were wounded after being assaulted by Israeli soldiers in the West Bank Governorate of Tubas, noting the difficulty in sheltering those forcibly displaced as a result of the Israeli operation.

title: Israel renews air strikes on Rafah as army demolishes homes in Khan Younis
summary:
Israel renews air strikes on Rafah as army demolishes homes in Khan Younis

Palestinian media on Thursday reported renewed Israeli air strikes on the city of Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip.

The Israeli army also carried out a demolition operation with heavy gunfire from its helicopters behind the yellow line east of Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip, Al Jazeera reported. 

The report added that the forces carried out air strikes on areas beyond the yellow line east of Gaza City in the central Gaza Strip.

title: Israeli army launches fresh raids across West Bank as Tubas siege continues
summary:
Israeli army launches fresh raids across West Bank as Tubas siege continues

Israeli forces on Thursday carried out raids and arrests in the cities of Qalqilya, Tubas and Tulkarm in the northern occupied West Bank, Palestinian media have reported. 

The report said that Israeli soldiers raided a house in the Kafr Saba neighbourhood of Qalqilya, arrested a young man from his home in Tubas, and stormed the Dhannaba suburb east of Tulkarm.

Israeli forces have laid siege to the town of Tammun in the Tubas Governorate, located 13 kilometres northeast of Nablus in the West Bank, where at least 60 Palestinians have been arrested and dozens have been forcibly displaced from their homes.  

The mayor Tammun said that the forces have displaced many families, turning their homes into military barracks and sealed the town. The Israeli army also cut off roads connecting the town with the rest of the West Bank, and severed electricity lines and drinking water pipes.

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning Middle East Eye readers,

Here are the latest updates from Gaza and the region, as Israel has already violated the 10 October ceasefire more than 500 times, killing at least 357 Palestinians: 

  • Israel is continuing the bombing in Gaza. In the past few hours, Israeli aircraft launched a series of raids on the Al-Tuffah and Al-Shuja’iyya neighbourhoods, east of Gaza City.

  • The Israeli forces carried out more raids and arrests in the cities of Qalqilya, Tubas and Tulkarm in the northern occupied West Bank, where, since Wednesday morning, more than 60 Palestinians have been arrested and dozens have been forcibly displaced from their homes. 

  • Two members of the Palestinian Red Crescent Society were wounded as a result of an attack by the Israeli forces on them in the town of Qabatiya, south of Jenin, in the occupied West Bank.

  • Hamas has condemned the Israeli assault on Gaza and the killing of fighters in Rafah, calling it a blatant violation of the ceasefire agreement.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

- Israel is carrying out heavy overnight strikes on parts of Gaza City in the north, and Rafah in the south of the Gaza Strip, local media are reporting. Israel has already violated the 10 October ceasefire more than 500 times.

- Israeli forces launched an extensive military assault on the northern occupied West Bank city of Tubas on Wednesday. Troops stormed Palestinian homes in the early morning hours in the towns of Tammun, Tayasir and Aqaba, turning several houses into temporary military barracks. Residents were forcibly removed from their homes.

- A wounded Palestinian man was arrested from an ambulance by Israeli soldiers at the gates of Tammun, the Palestinian Red Crescent Society said. Mohammad Ala'a Bani Odeh had only recently been released in the captive exchange negotiated by Hamas. 

- A Trump administration official confirmed reports that it is working on a plan to build housing for thousands of "screened" Palestinians behind the so-called yellow line in Gaza, which is occupied by Israeli troops, according to a report by The New York Times published on Wednesday. 

- The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (Ocha) said that on 24 and 25 November, its partners in Gaza managed to distribute 5,328 tarpaulins to 1,776 households after heavy rains and wind flooded and destroyed thousands of displacement tents over the past week.

title: Israel carrying out air strikes on Gaza City, Rafah
summary:
Israel carrying out air strikes on Gaza City, Rafah

Israel is carrying out heavy overnight strikes on parts of Gaza City in the north, and Rafah in the south of the Gaza Strip, local media are reporting. 

Israel has already violated the 10 October ceasefire more than 500 times, officials in Gaza have said.

title: United Nations distributes more than 5,000 tarpaulins after heavy rain in Gaza
summary:
United Nations distributes more than 5,000 tarpaulins after heavy rain in Gaza

The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (Ocha) said on Wednesday that on 24 and 25 November, its partners in Gaza managed to distribute 5,328 tarpaulins to 1,776 households after heavy rains and wind flooded and destroyed thousands of displacement tents over the past week.

Ocha also said that 2,232 blankets went out to 558 households in Deir al Balah and Khan Younis.

On Tuesday, an Ocha partner resumed tent distribution in Gaza City, the agency said, with the aim of providing one tent to each of the 258 families identified as requiring shelter there. 

Officials in Gaza had previously said that since the ceasefire went into effect, Israel has only allowed in 30,000 tents, while in actuality, in light of the weather conditions, the need is for 300,000 tents - ten times the amount.

title: Elit wildfire finally contained, becoming symbol of national solidarity
summary: Sari, IRNA – A persistent and devastating wildfire in the protected Chaharbagh forests of Elit village in northern Iran has been successfully extinguished after weeks of tireless collective effort, becoming a powerful symbol of national solidarity.

title: Iran seeks reparations, accountability for US role in Israeli aggression: Envoy
summary: New York, IRNA – Iran’s envoy to the United Nations has emphasized that Tehran reserves its right to pursue all legal avenues to hold the United States accountable and seek full compensation for its involvement in June strikes on the Islamic Republic.

title: Iran and France emphasize need to reduce tensions
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi and his French counterpart, Jean-Noel Barrot, met and held talks in Paris on Wednesday.

title: Iran calls on international community to uphold rights of chemical weapons victims
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi in a post on his X account has described Iran being elected as a member of the Executive Council of the Chemical Weapons Convention as a meaningful step for all those who believe in a world free of chemical weapons.

title: Hezbollah leader says ‘opening’ is on the horizon
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Hezbollah Secretary-General Sheikh Naim Qassem said in a message to Basij (volunteer) groups on the anniversary of its establishment on Wednesday that despite intensifying crises, “an opening is on the horizon” and the cycle of US-Israeli aggression would eventually come to an end.

title: Champions League: Arsenal vs. Bayern Munich preview, lineups, stats
summary: Arsenal hosts Bayern Munich on Wednesday, November 26, for a key Champions League clash. Discover the lineups, stats, and figures of this meeting in this report.

title: Iran urges West’s accountability in arming Saddam with chemical weapons
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi says Western countries must be held accountable for supplying and equipping former Iraqi ruler, Saddam Hussein, with chemical weapons that were used against civilians, both in Iran and Iraq.

title: Agriculture minister arrives in Moscow for grain and livestock feed talks
summary: Moscow, IRNA – Agriculture Minister Gholamreza Nouri Ghezeljeh arrived in Moscow on Wednesday for a two-day visit aimed at expanding agricultural cooperation, including trade in grains and livestock feed.

title: Over 1,140 Iranians among world’s top 1% most-cited researchers
summary: Shiraz, IRNA – The Islamic World Science Citation (ISC) Institute has listed 1,142 Iranian scholars among the world's top 1 percent most-cited researchers.

title: Iran Navy turns the sea into power zone: Admiral Sayyari
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Deputy Chief of the Iranian Army for Coordination Rear Admiral Habibollah Sayyari has emphasized the Navy's capability to transform the sea from a potential zone of threat to a symbol of dignity and power of the Islamic Republic of Iran.

title: Pakistan calls for closer counterterrorism partnership with Iran
summary: Islamabad, IRNA – Field Marshal Syed Asim Munir, Pakistan's Chief of Army Staff, has stressed the need for closer cooperation with Iran to combat terrorism and deal with security challenges faced by the two neighbors.

title: Iran, Turkey aim for $10 billion trade volume
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iranian Minister of Industry, Mine and Trade Mohammad Atabak has announced plans to increase bilateral trade between Iran and Turkey by $2 billion in the coming year, targeting a total trade volume of $10 billion.

title: Earthquake of 6.6 magnitude strikes off Indonesia’s Sumatra
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 27 (MNA) – A powerful earthquake of 6.6 magnitude struck off the Indonesian island of Sumatra on Thursday, the US Geological Survey (USGS) said.

title: Heart of Fatima Zahra, Mirror of God: A Mystical Analysis
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 27 (MNA) – Hazrat Fatima al-Zahra (SA) has a unique position to the extent that she has been introduced in narrations as “God’s proof of divine proofs” and “the soul of the Prophet.” The Lady Fatima (PBUH) is the mirror of God.

title: Washington shooter identified as Afghan national
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 27 (MNA) – The gunmen who shot at US National Guard members in Washington, DC, has been identified as a 29-year-old Afghan national, CBS News reported.

title: Iranian border guard martyred in Saravan
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 27 (MNA) – An Iranian border guard was martyred while carrying out his duties in Saravan Country in Sistan and Baluchestan Province in southeast Iran.

title: Iran, France's FMs stress need to ease tensions
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 27 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi and his French counterpart, Jean-Noel Barrot, met and held talks in Paris on Wednesday to discuss a broad range of issues, including Iran nuclear issue.

title: Iran seeks accountability for US role in Israeli aggression
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 27 (MNA) – Iran’s envoy to the United Nations has emphasized that Tehran reserves its right to pursue all legal avenues to hold the United States accountable and seek full compensation for its involvement in June strikes on Iran.

title: Agriculture min. says Iran wants to be the regional food hub
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 26 (MNA) – Agriculture Minister Gholamreza Nouri Ghezeljeh arrived in Moscow on Wednesday for a two-day visit aimed at expanding agricultural cooperation, including trade in grains and livestock feed.

title: Tehran, Islamabad play key role in confronting common threats
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 26 (MNA) – The secretary of Iran’s Supreme National Security Council (SNSC) says that Iran and Pakistan play a pivotal role in tackling shared threats, such as terrorism.

title: Netanyahu brought Israel defeat on all fronts: Israeli daily
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 26 (MNA) – The policies of the occupying regime’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu have led to Israel’s defeat across diplomatic, military, and strategic fronts, an Israeli newspaper has said.

title: HTS forces open fire on peaceful Alawite protesters
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 26 (MNA) – Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS) forces have opened fire on mass protests led by members of Syria's Alawite minority in coastal cities, where crowds took to the streets to denounce HTS-led sectarian violence.

title: Secret DOJ memo exposes flaws in US boat strike justification
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 26 (MNA) – A classified Justice Department memo reveals the legal reasoning behind deadly boat strikes in the Caribbean, clashing with Trump’s public anti-drug narrative.

title: Iran pursuing compensation for Sardasht chemical victims: FM
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 26 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi says that his ministry is pursuing compensation for Sardasht chemical victims, who sustained injuries as a result of chemical attacks by the former Baathist regime.

title: «خلیل» و «دشت می‌خواند» از جشنواره کردی هامبورگ جایزه گرفتند
summary: جایزه بهترین فیلم و تقدیر ویژه جشنواره کردی هامبورگ به «خلیل» و «دشت می‌خواند» رسید.

title: پیام تسلیت قالیباف در پی درگذشت «حاج محمدکریم عسگریان»
summary: رئیس مجلس با صدور پیامی درگذشت حاج محمدکریم عسگریان، پیرغلام اهل بیت (ع) و پدر شهید مجید عسگریان را تسلیت گفت.

title: افزایش کشته‌های آتش‌سوزی در هنگ کنگ به ۴۴ نفر+ فیلم
summary: رسانه‌ها از افزایش شمار جان‌باختگان آتش‌سوزی گسترده در یک مجتمع مسکونی در هنگ کنگ به ۴۴ نفر خبر داده و اعلام کردند که علاوه بر مصدوم شدن ده‌ها نفر، ۲۷۹ نفر همچنان مفقود هستند.

title: ضرب الاجل دادگستری آذربایجان غربی برای حل مشکلات محله قره درویش خوی
summary: ارومیه- رئیس کل دادگستری آذربایجان غربی برای حل مشکلات محله قره درویش خوی ضرب الاجل دو هفته‌ای صادر کرد.

title: رئیس شورای شهر بوشهر: طرح بهسازی گذر خواجه‌ها تصویب شد
summary: بوشهر- رئیس و سخنگوی شورای اسلامی شهر بوشهر از تصویب بهسازی گذر خواجه‌ها و موافقت با تفاهم‌نامه شهرک نیایش در نشست این شورا خبر داد.

title: استخدام پلیس فتا سیستان و بلوچستان آغاز شد
summary: زاهدان - پلیس فتا سیستان و بلوچستان به منظور تقویت توان تخصصی خود، فرآیند جذب و استخدام نیروهای جوان و دارای مهارت در حوزه‌های مرتبط با فناوری را آغاز کرده است.
